Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for real-time web functionality, including expected user load, latency, and scalability needs.
Design the architecture for integrating Azure SignalR Service into the web application, including client-server communication patterns and backend service integration.
Create an Azure SignalR Service instance in the Azure portal, specifying the appropriate pricing tier and region.
Set up authentication and authorization for the Azure SignalR Service, including Azure Active Directory integration or other identity providers.
Install and configure the SignalR SDK in the web application. Set up client and server-side code for real-time communication.
Enable encryption for data in transit using HTTPS and configure access control policies for the SignalR endpoints.
Perform functional testing to ensure real-time communication works as expected, including connection establishment, message delivery, and failover scenarios.
Set up monitoring for the Azure SignalR Service using Azure Monitor and Application Insights. Configure alerts for connection issues, performance degradation, and usage metrics.
Analyze performance metrics and optimize the SignalR Service configuration, such as scaling out instances or adjusting connection limits.
Create detailed documentation for the SignalR Service setup, including configuration details, usage instructions, and troubleshooting steps.
Provide training sessions for the development team on using Azure SignalR Service, including SDK usage and debugging techniques.
Verify that the Azure SignalR Service setup complies with organizational security policies and regulatory requirements. Conduct periodic security audits.
